preqs: Enrolment by Department of Forensic Medicine permission only.

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course type {04, 05, 06, 06G, 06PG, 06PGZA, 07, 07G, 07PG, 11, 42, 50PG, 56, 76, 78}

description: Autopsy techniques will be taught via experiential learning in the mortuary, with experienced practitioners from the VIFM acting as tutors/supervisors. Over the 12 months of training, the student will be required to apply the learned techniques to different types of cases, allocated to ensure as wide a range of experience as possible is gained. Students will also be given practical instruction in techniques to forensic  odontology and anthropology that are used to support forensic pathology practice, particularly in identifying unknown remains.
faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
